name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
I had a nice experience here.

I ordered a three-topping slice of pizza: ham, pineapple, and spinach(don't ask why about the spinach lol). It came out to just under 10$ including a tip. I was pleasantly surprised by the thickness of the bread/crust. It was puffy and wonderful. The wait wasn't bad at all, but I was the only person in queue at the time. And the man that eventually handed me my pizza was particularly kind.

The ordering system was a bit unclear at first, because the kiosks were spread apart on the front counter and there were employees hovering nearby(I wondered if they were going to take my order), but I figured out relatively quickly that I was expected to tap away on the screen.

It's pizza at the mall!! It's not that deep! There are many seats to choose from, and there are a lot of people passing though, so the environment is on the noisier side. There are many other food options nearby in the food court, but if you're feeling pizza, might as well stop here !!

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: While a college student at U.C. Berkeley decades ago, I lived on slices of Blondie's Pizza on Telegraph Avenue.  While visiting San Francisco, I was excited that there was a Blondie's in the basement food court of the Westfield San Francisco Centre.  I ordered a pepperoni slice, a California slice, and a soda.  The California slice has pepperoni, green peppers, and mushrooms.  While the pizza slices looked good, the taste was just better than okay.  Now I have the urge to go back to Berkeley to see if the Blondie's Pizza on Telegraph Ave is as good as I remember as a college student.  While I am likely to give Blondie's in SF a 2nd chance, I wasn't impressed the first time.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
I missed Blondies of Berkeley, Powell, and concord..but it will remain in the past.  The slices are big and the bread is decent, but the taste just isn't there.  Tasted like cardboard and flavorless.  

Staff is also unfriendly.  This kiosk and forgetting half the order is frustrating for staff and customer.  They'll mess up the extra $0.99 ranch and drink add ons, and act irritable when you ask for them. I went at opening,  how can you be that irritable already?!  The same man, if my eyes served me correctly, used no gloves, and parted the stringed cheese from pizza, with his bare hands.  

I can't ask for much for $6 pizza.  If you're hungry, you're hungry.  The best thing about the location is knowing there's other places worth trying in the food court.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
I thought I was about to head home with my mom, but it appeared she chose to dine in Westfield Concourse at least once.  Why not?  Perhaps I could settle for a bite since it's lunchtime.  And Blondie's Pizza was worth it if we needed enough energy to proceed.

I admitted; the pesto penne pasta I chose took like at least 15 minutes to make it Al Dente, while my mom's pizza slice took a couple of minutes to heat up.  But it's worth it since the pasta was a healthier choice.  I once had pesto pasta even in a large portion, and it didn't take long for me to finish the whole thing in one sitting.

Perhaps the next time I come to Blondie's Pizza, it's better to choose a slice of pizza if I'm in a hurry.  There's nothing to complain about the customer service since it's fair.  One of the best kiosks to start with.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
Wow the memories from this place.....I remember going to the original near the Cable Cars when I was a teenager.

Long story short they're here in the mall, their prices are slightly higher, but the slice itself is pretty big and filling.

They're not the best pizza place, but for the mall they certainly are. It's a way to stretch your dollar further and the staff will heat up your pizza extra hot if you ask them to.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: Nostalgia and memories of happiness in old San Francisco . Now it's back again in modern day San Francisco . The pizza is almost the same or if not the same taste I remembered it back on Powell street by the cable car turnaround. The pepperoni slice is my favorite and it's still delicious in 2022. I am glad Blondie's is back again.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
Talk about nostalgia! I grew up eating at the Powell location next to Rasputin Music. My mom would take my sister and I there when we were little and we would each order a fat slice on a plate. There was no seating upstairs (there was downstairs) and everyone would stand around the counters against the wall and devour the thick, hot, cheesy, gooey pizza! It was all goodness! In high school, I would come here for a slice with friends and we would all hang out downstairs for hours talking, laughing, listening to music. I would hit up Rasputin next door to look for music. Those were the good old days. The epitome of my youth!

When I heard Blondie's was reopening in the Westfield center's food court, I HAD to come check it out! There it was - different that it's predecessor which was a 2 story, fast paced pizza joint. It is now a small version, a walk up counter next to a hot dog place. But, the pizza smells the same and taste the same. It is still the thick slice! The soft pillowy crust and the stringy hot cheese topped with pepperoni. It made me want to cry to taste this again. Blondie's is still my favorite pizza place and will always hold a special place in my heart. I am happy you are back.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
The pizza of my youth. I remember when they were on Powell Street near the cable car turnaround. Way, way, waaaay back in the 80s a slice and a can of soda was $1.50.  Totally worth it.

I was excited to see Blondies make their triumphant return. I decided I was definitely going to try them when I went to see "The Batman" on IMAX.

Sadly, I can't remember what Blondies tasted like, even though I must have eaten there dozens and dozens of times. Ah, the wonder of growing old.

A slice of pepperoni is now $7. It was a little greasy, but good enough for me to order another slice. Next time, I'll just buy a whole pie.

All in all, good pizza for the food court.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
One of my fondest childhood memories was going with my dad to Rasputin's on Powell St to look at music / VHS tapes to buy, and then going next door to Blondie's to eat pizza downstairs. So of course I was devastated when they closed down - I believe when I was in high school.

When I saw on Twitter that Blondie's was reopening in Westfield mall, I HAD to go there. There was no line, I just had to wait for the cashier to be ready to take my order.

The pizza tastes similar to how I remembered it. Texture is definitely the same, but the recipe feels slightly different? I recall the pizza having a bit more flavor, but maybe that's rosy retrospection?

Still would come back here, no question.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
Was anyone as disappointed as I was when the Blondie's Pizza on Powell closed? Well it looks like they're back but in a new location a few blocks from their original spot and now living on the lower level of the Westfield San Francisco Centre (in the food court). Same great pizza and taste that I never realized how much I missed.

Stopped by this new Blondie's location for the first time a few weeks ago with my husband. We were immediately greeted by their friendly staff and our order was quickly filled with the freshest slices they had available on the display. Prices were reasonable and justified that signature Blondie's Pizza taste. My husband and I each ordered a Pepperoni Special ( a slice of pepperoni with a drink) and an additional California slice which was their special of the day. The California slice had pepperoni, mushroom, and green pepper as toppings. All slices were a good size, tasted as if they were prepared and served fresh, and had quality toppings. A solid pizza choice while in the area or shopping at Westfield.

Super excited to have Blondie's Pizza back in the area. Though it was my first time visiting this spot, it's definitely not my last. Looking forward to trying more of their combinations in the future.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
I'm unable to find any sort of confirmation if this is the same Blondie's pizza I grew up eating from its iconic Powell St location.  In any case, the pizza looks the same.  The logo looks the same.  Unfortunately, the pizza doesn't taste the same.

I remember getting the pepperoni special, slice and a soda, for a few bucks.  Everyone would be standing around, dumping parm cheese and peppers on our slices, and satisfyingly devouring them.  It was a madhouse but it created the ambiance and gave Blondie's the feel that we all loved.  

Anyhoo, this location is in the food court at Westfield.  The pizza sits out just like before.  You order a slice and they'll heat it up for you in their oven.  Unfortunately, the pizza fell short and just didn't live up to its name.  For around $8 now, you can get the same pepperoni special.  

I also opted for a small sausage supreme.  It was made fresh and came out piping hot...but goodness, it was plain and tasteless.  

I do appreciate going back to memory lane.  Sadly, it just wasn't what I remembered.  3 stars.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: Nostalgia got a hold of me when I saw Blondie's inside the Westfield mall recently. It was just okay. Kind of disappointed in the small slices. I feel like these are cut smaller. Anyway, Hb and I tried both the pepperoni and the cheese slices and we thought they were average; quite bland on the cheese pizza, but I prefer and like the pepperoni one a little more because it has a bit more flavor.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: Don't know why I can't find the Berkeley location on Yelp because that's the one we were at. On my culinary quest for a nice slice of pizza, I had to hit Blondies, it's just as I remember it from my teenage years except with a modern, contact free ordering station. The slices are huge and come out hotter than lava. We got a cheese slice and a pepperoni. For my taste the sauce was a little heavy and the crust is thick and fluffy. The cheese is perfect and overall, a really satisfying slice.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
Abe's Pizza across the street is a much better option. It is the same owner and same pizza. This Blondie's location is poorly managed. Do not use the kiosk. The staff runs around like chickens with their heads chopped off as tickets come in. The thing is is they only offer 3 different pizzas. It should be very easy to get the order heat the pizza and give it to the customer. A 3 minute wait. People who placed their orders with the cashier received that experience. Those who ordered through the kiosk waited 20 minutes. The staff had no process in place. They had no clue which tickets needed to be served and which had gone out. They began just asking people what they ordered. Which is bad business, because then people will begin saying they ordered 2 slices, a water, a soda, etc.

Also they are not following health code standards. The people pouring the sodas were using the cup to put the ice in instead of an ice shovel and they are also not cleaning their soda machine, because the Coke I ordered tasted like a combination of Coke and Dr. Pepper. They have a lot of work to do.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
Yes, it's very much what I remember growing up going down town hanging out and everyone just knew we hitting up Blondie's for a fat slice of pizza and affordable prices. They'd always have fire meal deals. So, I had to get a slice and tell my teen daughter about that Blondie's pizza life. We enjoyed and I reminisced about back in my days as soon I took the 1st bite. No no... actually at 1st smell of the garlic oil that's brushed on the hot & so soft inner and crispy otter crust.

Question for my folks who knew the old Blondie's. Where is My Cuzin? The lady who worked next door at the Wholesale Jewelry. Everyone bought thei jewelry from her.
Thanks for RE-opening in the city Blondie's Pizza.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
I gave in to the nostalgia angle. Similar to many, I grew up with my mom taking me to Blondie's when it was along Powell. I remember being shorter and smaller, sticking close to my mom, surrounded by strangers all standing, focused on their pizza. Then I remember revisiting as a young adult, often lounging downstairs with a slice or two (usually two, special of the day and a pepperoni!).

The character is obviously different. Tie dye shirts have been traded for a sleek neon sign. It's normal, natural for change. What matters most is the food, and sadly, it didn't seem as good for me.

Sometimes the special of the day is a preference issue, but I felt like it just didn't have that flavor I loved in both the 2000s and the 2010s. Even right now, I'm giving 3 stars and not lower because I feel like I had to be mistaken. Maybe another day's special would be better, maybe I just needed to try a pepperoni slice.

Was it user error? I don't know, but my heart did hurt as I walked by the old storefront, nothing more than a dark, empty building. The times change, people change, and that kind of sorrow probably stays with you, even if the food was still good.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
Hit or Miss Blondie!

Ordered @& paid for a medium extra pepperoni pie, staff himself was hesitant to give it to me as it didn't look there were extra pepperoni yet still tried to hand it off like all was good so I said that doesn't look like the pep pizza on display so he took it back and they all looked at my like I'm crazy & now is see that guy just slapped some pepperoni & a slight sprinkle of cheese

A huge miss!

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: I used to go to Blondie's as a kid when it used to be on Powell and Ellis. Way back when...loved their pizza back then and love their pizza now. Still tastes the same and the crust is soft and pillowy. So glad they were reopened although in the Westfield mall. They've got a bunch of other items on the menu that I do not recall ever seeing before. Unless I just really never paid attention because I was a child and all u cared for was the pizza!!! Can't wait to try the other items. Their staff is always friendly which is always a plus.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
the kinda pizza that's like, you know, cartoonish in how melty the cheese is. i mean, honestly its kind of bland pizza but if you want stretchy cheese, delicious doughy crust and sauce by all means this is pizza.

i live in oakland and sometimes take bart to powell just for a greasy sloppy slice.

anyone giving this place less than 5 stars is a monster.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: It's surprised me that they were still open after 20 years. The pizza was ok at best but at least it still tasted the same after all this time. Would I get it again no. For two slices of cheese pizza it was 14 dollars. That's crazy!!!!!  I could have gotten a small pizza somewhere else.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
Double check your receipt!!!
Pizza is actually not bad.
I got their pizza couple of times but this time a middle age lady over charged me 10dollars for a slice of pizza(usually it should be around 7). I did ask her if that's the price for just one slice she said yes. Later I saw the receipt I paid for a extra soda which I didn't get. The lady might asked before I paid (I couldn't even hear her)but turned out she didn't give that soda to me.
:(

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
I'm so glad blondies is back with their original recipie, the crust is so soft and the nostalgia of 1990's Blondie's pizza is still there.

I recommend the first plain cheese or  2nd pepperoni right out of the oven. I wouldn't get a re heated slice.

Love this place

I tired getting a small personal pie but I would recommend just eating fresh slices

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
Ya'll need to change cashiers... looks like they dont know what hell they're doing.

Waited 30mins for my food & she gave it to someone else & left with nothing. They dont even know how to fix the situation and make the customer happy. Smh

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
Omg so good , it taste just like how I remembered it with the fluffy dough and the nostalgic sauce.

Slices are about 7 bucks and they are huge, I love either the cheese or the pepperoni. The key is for them to bring out a fresh pizza and just get slices right then and there. Not to found on the re heating it doesn't taste the same.  I'm so happy that blondies came back!

Servers are newbies but these days good help is hard to find

I came here two days in a row first day I opted for a small pepperoni pizza because it was just 3 bucks more and I could share small slices with friends. Second day I just got a cheese and pep slice just as good .  Even the crust was soft and chewy not burnt like these new style pizzas.  Totally recommend blondies. I'll be back only thing I wish was they had more sauce on the crust just so that there's some more flavor but , anyways even the crust plain is so good ..

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
I stopped today after the Big Game.  I wanted to order three slices of pizzas. The young lady asked me to order them on the machine. I couldn't figure it out, I'm a boomer. No sympathy or help from them. So disappointed. Didn't get help or pizza.
Walked away sad and hungry.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
So I was shopping at the Westfield center the other day and then I stopped by the food court and guess what I was overwhelmed to see the pizza place I grew up devouring their slices back in the city, I got the famously exquisite pepperoni special and it took me back in time..
So today I was back again and I decided to try their pasta, they have different flavors but I go with my favorite marinara chicken; portion was generous, fresh basil and parmesan cheese was flavorful, grilled chicken was savory and the pasta was very yummy
Highly recommended

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
Awful awful awful experience. Waited an entire 45 minutes for 2 slices of cheese. Workers were super rude and actually annoyed that I asked about my order after waiting 30 minutes lol. Insane.

Do not visit this grimy location.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
At the Blondies Pizza place is absolutely a legend. I use to eat a best delicious pizza when I was Kid as a childhood memory. I use to eat types of best delicious large pizza like vegetable pizza, BBQ pizza, pepperoni pizza, cheese pizza, Hawaii jalapeño pineapple pizza. It's was AWESOME!!!

The staff are very cool & well respectful. The price is very fair & very reasonable amazing deal. Best customer service ever!!! Great Job!!!

Grade: A+ (Excellent)

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: $8.20 for a slice of pepperoni? Crazy these places really try to take you to the bank any chance they get. Massive mistake on my end buying a super salty, doughy slice of pizza. Never again.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: I happened to be in the food court area Blondie's is located in and decided to give it a try. What a disappointment. There isn't any interaction with an employee. You have to do everything through the online app at the counter. One of the joys of the original Blondie's was interacting with an employee. Not only that, but it's much more expensive. And the food is rather bland tasting. Ah well. Live and learn. The new owners are banking on the nostalgia and good vibes that the original Blondie's had, but are not to be found here. There's lots of choices for food here. If I have to pay high prices, I'll find a place that's actually worth it.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: I loved the place when I was younger and when I heard it was opening again I had to try it out so I went with my friends ordered a large pepperoni pizza. And I got to say I felt like that one scene in ratatouille where the guy try's the dish and visits his memory I remember where the old lady lace was going every day to get my slice. So I would recommend to anyone plus their pepperoni is beef not pork that's why I eat their.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: Very average pizza. The marinara they use for the pizza tastes like the marinara sauce you could buy from Safeway. The cheese was bland.  Will not be interested in trying again.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: I decided to come here during my lunch break since my job is pretty close to Westfield. I ordered the cheesy bread. After waiting patiently, they, unfortunately, gave me the wrong item, a cheese pizza slice. Anyways, no big deal... we're human, mistakes happen. The employee apologized and mentioned the cheesy bread would be ready in 4 minutes, I ended up waiting a bit over 10 minutes. On the bright side, they corrected their mistake and gave me the cheesy bread. However, it was a bit bland and the marinara dipping sauce was extremely cold (almost as if they took it out of the fridge last minute). Bit of an underwhelming experience.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: My order has been "lost" numerous times, even when only one other person ordered around the same time. They also can't seem to put the pizza in long enough for it to actually get hot lol. The people are really nice but I'm confused why it's difficult lol

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
Second visit. Walked into Westfield and noticed the crowd is coming back. Except at Blondie's, nobody there
Why us because 2 slices of pizza, no drinks, no tip, $15.
Nuff said, hope your death spiral isn't too steep, won't be back and I doubt I'm alone. Even downtown I can buy a whole fresh pizza for that.
Used to be $2.50/slice still warm from the oven because the turnover was so high.
Yes, times have changed but we just AREN'T paying $7.50/slice.
Not ever.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: I'm so glad they're open again! I love this place! Highly recommended! To all the locals in SF! If you remember growing up and strolling outside Powell St. when you were younger, well now they're back inside Westfield Shopping Center! Check them out and it tastes just as good as you remember it!

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: This place made me mad. I dropped by to grab some breadsticks and sat there for 15 minutes while the employees sat around and talked. It was kinda cool that they cooked the breadsticks right there but super inconvenient because I was trying to grab something quick. Finally my $9 breadsticks come out of the oven and they have absolutely no flavor, they're literally dough sticks. The marinara is straight out of the fridge, not heated at all, and is just spaghetti sauce. Do not go here.
reviewer_location: Santa Fe Hills, San Marcos, CA

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: The classic delicious Blondie's pizza is back in SF!!! So glad they have a new location, definitely worth the trip to visit. There pepperoni is the best in the world, bar none. The pizza is thick and cooked to perfection. Delicious, filling, and CHEAP! I recommend this place to everyone because they are the most delicious pizza I've ever had.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment:
I was waiting for someone...and I got hungry.  I walked around the food court at Westfield.  I thought oh all the fancy food is at Bloomingdale's food court.  
There it was Blondie's Pizza! I was so happy I felt like jumping up and down.  The server was really helpful.  I ordered a 12 inch pizza.  The wait was good, not too long.  
    I walked to my car.  I was so excited.  Blondie's Pizza where have you been? I missed you from my telemarketing days.  Almost every weekend I would be there.
     Perfect crust, slightly sweet sauce, crispy pepperoni, and an phenomenal cheese.  Put them all together and you get a pizza to die for.  I don't even like pizza but if I can only eat one food for the rest of my life it would be the pepperoni pizza from Blondie's.  
I hope this Blondie's Pizza stays open for a long time.  I live pretty far away but I will make trips just to eat this pizza.  Looking forward to eating more pizza from Blondie's.  To everyone reading this try this pizza! To die for doesn't even begin to describe how good it tastes!

La migliore pizza!

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: I grew up eating the original Blondies Pizza on Market and I have to be honest this one missed. Flavor profile is not the same I remember biting into slightly burnt pepperoni with a slightly salty cheese this cheese had no flavor at allCrust is the same  sauce is different as well

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: Pizza is always good, i tried the spaghetti and meatballs, the portion was huge but it wasn't anything special unfortunately. But pizza is 10/10

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: In my opinion. Everything thing was great,they had great customer service and most importantly the pizza was absolutely positively delicious would 100 hundred percent recommend,and also their pepperoni pizza is delicous and is beef

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: Pizza with personality! Maybe not the best pizza, but this pizza has personality and I love it!

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: First time at the Westfield Mall here in SF, was really lost on what to grab for lunch, stopped by here at Blondies to order a simple meal of a slice of pepperoni pizza and sprite. Such a quick and short line and great service, no wait and hassle-free. The slice of pizza was pretty huge, the sauce was decent not super salty. I came back at the end of my day to grab a small pizza for my way home

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: I order medium veggie pizza. Pizza isn't medium size and look like small pizza for 16.95. It is not big enough for medium pizza. I have four people to share those pizza. Only 2 slices per person.  Pizza taste not bad at all because we don't like salty pizza. Need improving their services with customer's. They need organizers their food preparation. Messy in the food preparation table.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: I only get a half hour for lunch.  went to blondies cashier was slow and I ask him twice not to put the garlic butter around the edges and guess what he did lunch break shot. Won't be goi back

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: Don't remember the crust being this soft guess when you get new cooks you get different taste

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: Anyone who grew up in sf knows this pizza brand has alot of memories for us locals. I used to go here all the time as a kid when it was on powell street. I used to remember how they had all the condiment shakers chained up against the tables. Honestly i wished they didnt open inside the mall because its such a small and tiny space. There is only one oven and that can make orders very slow. The old location they had a bunch of pizza ovens going at once. To me it makes zero sense to open inside the mall cause rent itself is the biggest killer. Im sure if they opened near the old location they would save a ton more money. Anyways the pizza does still pack the same taste it used to. Im glad they are back

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: Missed this pizza hangout! I used to go there almost every weekend for lunch when I stepped out to enjoy my day before they were temporarily closed so now I'm happy that they're back in business. Welcome back even thought it isn't the same owner. AWESOME!!!

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: So happy they Are back.   My bones were raised on this pizza.   My favorite one is their pepperoni and fountain drink.  Way to go Blondies.  Thank you again for coming to the mall.

name: Tonyâ€™s Pizza Napoletana
reviewer_comment: I was so sad when Blondies on Powell shut down.  So happy to see Blondies back in the mall.  I stopped bye for a slice of pepperoni special for 7:95, it is not bad for a slice and drink, the flavor is as good as I remember it.  I will come back for sure.  DO NOT leave the mall without trying them out.
